results.title: More power from the atom
results.creator_credit: Frank Green, Ace Films and United Kingdom Atomic Energy Authority
results.brief_description: A resume of the steps which have been taken to implement Britain’s extensive atomic power-station program. Explains what the stations involve in terms of nuclear power production developments, and shows the building of the new reactors in progress and the installation of their various equipment.

results.title: More or less: a film about food
results.creator_credit: Healthsharing Women. Publishing and Production Group, Paddy Stitt and Lawrie Whittle
results.brief_description: Andrew Daddo outlines the “More or less” diet which is advocated by the Life Be In It campaign as a plan for eating for the “rest of your life”. By choosing carefully from the five basic food groups and eating more bread, cereals, fruit and vegetables, and less sugar, fat and salt, and exercising regularly, more children can became aware of the choices involved in planning a balanced diet.

results.title: More nuclear power stations = Flere atom kraftvoeker
results.brief_description: An examination of the operations required to enable nuclear power stations to function. Deals with the maintenance of reactors, the disposal of wastes and other factors related to this controversial source of energy.

results.title: More new handwriting
results.creator_credit: Diane O'Connor, Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development and Jeff Spencer
results.brief_description: Three related programs by Barbara Nichol on the teaching of the new handwriting style for Victorian government schools. 1.”The New handwriting”. Provides an introduction to the new handwriting course for all members of the school community. 2.”Learning handwriting”. Highlights the reasons for implementing the course. 3.”Victorian modern cursive”. Provides a demostration of the course.

results.title: More milk for more people
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Balla, ONF | NFB and Edmund Reid
results.brief_description: The black-and-white Holstein-Friesian cattle belong to the oldest improved dairy breed in the world and are famous as record milk producers. In Canada their pedigree is safeguarded through registration and control. In this film, foreign cattle buyers are shown why this breed of cattle, raised in Canada, is a safe purchase.

results.title: More like a friend
results.creator_credit: State of New York Division of Probation, Robert Kagan, Raanan Gissin, Don Schroeder and Fabrice Moussus
results.brief_description: A young man, following his first offence, is placed on probation. Members of the public are asked to explain what “probation” means to them. A professional probation officer explains that it in fact means “giving another chance to a person in trouble”. He, along with volunteer probation officers and probationers, explains the work done by volunteers, who sharing interests with the people placed in their care, end up thinking of them as a friend.

results.title: More homes for more people
results.creator_credit: Gordon Sparling, ONF | NFB and Anthony Short
results.brief_description: This film shows materials used in all stages of construction of three sets of semi-detached Canadian-style homes in the United Kingdom. The film was intended to encourage more builders to make their homes from Canadian lumber and by Canadian methods. Sir Donald Gibson, director general of research and development, reports on observations made in Canada.

results.title: More great escapes of World War 2
results.creator_credit: Greystone Communications, A&E Television Networks and Robert Kirk
results.brief_description: The second volume of a television documentary series made for The History Channel that chronicles legendary breakouts by prisoners of war during World War II contains two more episodes: “The escape from the USS Oaklahoma” and “The escape from Dunkirk: the way out”. Archival footage is combined with dramatic recreations and first person testimony to bring to life the courageous acts of civilians, soldiers and the resistance in WWII. “The Great Escapes of WWII” is also available.

results.title: More for less
results.creator_credit: Marty Ostrow, Film Australia, Chedd-Angier Productions and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Race to save the planet”.
A series of case studies which show how fossil fuels can either be used more efficiently or replaced altogether by alternative energy sources. The program stresses, however, that unless the alternatives are shown to be economically advantageous, no matter how environmentally desirable renewable energy sources are, they will not replace fossil fuels in the near future. Teacher’s notes accompany the video.

results.title: More common than measles and mumps
results.creator_credit: Student Animated Film Producers, ONF | NFB, Kiloran German and David Grimes
results.brief_description: An animated film for inclusion in programs of sex education for young people. The subject is venereal disease and the film was produced by young film-makers. The approach is in the form of a cartoon reporting the findings of two students assigned to investigate venereal disease as part of a health studies classroom project. The facts they gather, and convey in this film, are what all young people should know.
